009package _ImageJ_Examples;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.ImageStack;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016/**
017 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates how to iterate over the frames (slices)
018 * of an image stack. In this case each frame is simply inverted. No new
019 * frames are added to the stack. The result is automatically re-displayed
020 * (unless {@link NO_CHANGES} is specified).
021 * 
022 * @author W. Burger
023 *
024 */
025public class Stack_Processing_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
026        
027        ImagePlus im = null;    // keep a reference to the associated ImagePlus object
028        
029        public int setup(String args, ImagePlus im) {
030                this.im = im;
031                return DOES_8G + STACK_REQUIRED;
032        }
033
034        public void run(ImageProcessor ignored) {
035                ImageStack stack = im.getImageStack();
036                int K = stack.getSize();
037                for (int k = 1; k <= K; k++) {  // NOTE: slices are numbered from 1,...,K !!
038                        ImageProcessor ip = stack.getProcessor(k);
039                        ip.invert();
040                }
041        }
042}
